tit.j: 京都 - 広島・徳山線
tit.cmt: "route" is more natural than "line" when talking about a bus.

sen.j: 京都 - 広島・徳山線（きょうと - ひろしま・とくやません）は、京都府京都市・乙訓郡大山崎町・大阪府枚方市・高槻市と広島県広島市・大竹市・山口県岩国市・周南市を結ぶ高速バス路線である。
sen.e: The Kyoto-Hiroshima/Tokuyama Line is a highway bus line that connects Kyoto City in Kyoto pref./Oyamazaki-cho in Otokuni-gun in Kyoto pref./Hirakata City in Osaka pref./Takatsuki City in Osaka pref. and Hiroshima City in Hiroshima pref./Otake City in Hiroshima pref./Iwakuni City in Yamaguchi pref./Shunan City in Yamaguchi pref.

Kyoto–Hiroshima Tokuyama Bus Route is a highway bus route that connects Kyoto City (Kyoto Prefecture) and Shunan City (Yamaguchi Prefecture) via Oyamazaki-cho in Otokuni-gun (Kyoto Prefecture), Hirakata City (Osaka Prefecture), Takatsuki City (Osaka Prefecture), Hiroshima City (Hiroshima Prefecture), Otake City (Hiroshima Prefecture), and Iwakuni City (Yamaguchi Prefecture).
sen.cmt: To make this a little easier to read, I have put the names of the prefectures in parentheses.The translator submitted the following correction to her translation, which I have incorporated into the translation in the cell to the left. However, although the translator has changed "bus line" to just "bus", as the Japanese says "路線", I still think "bus route" is appropriate here.The Kyoto - Hiroshima Tokuyama Bus is a highway bus that runs from Kyoto City (Kyoto Prefecture) to Shunan City (Yamaguchi Prefecture), via Oyamazaki-cho in Otokuni-gun (Kyoto Prefecture), Hirakata City (Osaka Prefecture), Takatsuki City (Osaka Prefecture), Hiroshima City (Hiroshima Prefecture), Otake City (Hiroshima Prefecture), and Iwakuni City (Yamaguchi Prefecture).the削除しました。
sen.e: Kyoto–Hiroshima Tokuyama Bus Route is a highway bus route that connects Kyoto City (Kyoto Prefecture) and Shunan City (Yamaguchi Prefecture) via Oyamazaki-cho in Otokuni-gun (Kyoto Prefecture), Hirakata City (Osaka Prefecture), Takatsuki City (Osaka Prefecture), Hiroshima City (Hiroshima Prefecture), Otake City (Hiroshima Prefecture), and Iwakuni City (Yamaguchi Prefecture).

sen.j: 現在は京都 - 広島間の昼夜各1系統ずつのみである。
sen.e: Now there are only one route for day bus and one route for night bus that run between Kyoto and Hiroshima.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: At present, only one day bus and one night bus run between Kyoto and Hiroshima.
At present, only one day bus and one night bus run between Kyoto and Hiroshima.

sen.j: 本項目では運行会社と昼夜行の別により、かつての系統とともに一括して記す。
sen.e: In this article, we list the past services as well as the current services, referring to the operating bus company and the timetable.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: This article lists past services as well as current services based on information from the operating bus company and the timetable for the route.
This article lists past services as well as current services based on information from the operating bus company and the timetable for the route.

sen.e: Kyoto Kotsu in Kameoka City and Hiroshima Bus began operations of the SANYO EXPRESS and the Momiji-go.

Kyoto Kotsu in Kameoka City and Hiroshima Bus began operations of SANYO EXPRESS and Momiji-go.

sen.j: 当初は、祇園 - 広島バスセンター間で、昼行便、夜行便共に運行された（後に昼行便は廃止）。
sen.e: They initially operated day buses as well as night buses.(later, day buses were abolished.)
They initially operated day buses as well as night buses (later, day buses were abolished).
sen.cmt: コンマの位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: They initially operated day buses as well as night buses (later, day buses were abolished).
October 1, 1997:
October 1, 1997:
October 1, 1997:

sen.j: - 広島バスの都市間高速バスからの撤退により、SANYO EXPRESS・もみじ号の広島バス担当便が防長交通に移管された。
sen.e: As Hiroshima Bus had withdrawn from intercity highway bus business, Bocho Kotsu took over the management of the SANYO EXPRESS and the Momiji-go that had been operated by Hiroshima Bus.
As Hiroshima Bus had withdrawn from intercity highway bus business, Bocho Kotsu took over the management of SANYO EXPRESS and Momiji-go that had been operated by Hiroshima Bus.
As Hiroshima Bus had withdrawn from intercity highway bus business, Bocho Kotsu took over the management of SANYO EXPRESS and Momiji-go that had been operated by Hiroshima Bus.
November 1, 1997:
November 1, 1997:
November 1, 1997:

sen.j: - SANYO EXPRESS・もみじ号の広島側を徳山市（現・周南市）まで延長。
sen.e: The routes of the SANYO EXPRESS and the Momiji-go were extended to Tokuyama City (now Shunan City), the west of Hiroshima.
The routes of SANYO EXPRESS and Momiji-go were extended to Tokuyama City (now Shunan City), the west of Hiroshima.
The routes of SANYO EXPRESS and Momiji-go were extended to Tokuyama City (now Shunan City), the west of Hiroshima.

sen.j: 同時に愛称をSANYO EXPRESS・まいこ号へ変更。
sen.e: At the same time, the nicknames were changed to the SANYO EXPRESS/the Maiko-go.
sen.cmt: 正しくはAt the same time, the nickname of the Momiji-go was changed to the Maiko-go.
sen.e: At the same time, the nicknames were changed to SANYO EXPRESS/Maiko-go.
sen.cmt: the 削除しました。スペース削除しました
sen.e: At the same time, the nicknames were changed to SANYO EXPRESS/Maiko-go.
August 1, 2004:
August 1, 2004:
August 1, 2004:

sen.j: - 防長交通が単独で昼特急まいこ号を運行開始。
sen.e: Bocho Kotsu solely began operation of the daytime limited express Maiko-go.
Bocho Kotsu solely began operation of the daytime limited express Maiko-go.
Bocho Kotsu solely began operation of the daytime limited express Maiko-go.

sen.j: 同時に中国ジェイアールバスが単独で広島昼特急京都号を運行開始。
sen.e: At the same time, Chugoku JR Bus solely began operation of the Hiroshima daytime limited express Kyoto-go.
At the same time, Chugoku JR Bus solely began operation of the daytime limited express Hiroshima Kyoto-go.
sen.cmt: the daytime limited express Hiroshima Kyoto-goに訂正しました。
sen.e: At the same time, Chugoku JR Bus solely began operation of the daytime limited express Hiroshima Kyoto-go.
October 1, 2004:
October 1, 2004:
October 1, 2004:

sen.j: - 昼特急まいこ号が名神大山崎、名神高槻、名神茨木に停留所を増設。
sen.e: They placed new bus stops at Meishin Oyamazaki, Meishin Takatsuki, and Meishin Ibaraki for the daytime limited express Maiko-go.
sen.cmt: They placed new bus stops --- on the route of the bus.
sen.e: They placed new bus stops at Meishin Oyamazaki, Meishin Takatsuki, and Meishin Ibaraki for the daytime limited express Maiko-go.
They placed new bus stops at Meishin Oyamazaki, Meishin Takatsuki, and Meishin Ibaraki for the daytime limited express Maiko-go.
December 1, 2004:
December 1, 2004:
December 1, 2004:

sen.j: - 昼特急まいこ号の中筋駅・広島バスセンター - 徳山駅前間の相互利用が可能となる（広島 - 徳山・防府・山口・萩線と共通乗車可能。
sen.e: They began the mutually usable ticket service between the daytime limited express Maiko-go (valid for the area between Nakasuji Station/Hiroshima Bus Center and Tokuyama Station-mae) and Hiroshima – Tokuyama/Hofu/Yamaguchi/Hagi Line.

The new service began: when you had the ticket for the daytime limited express Maiko-go (from Nakasuji Station/Hiroshima Bus Center to Tokuyama Station-mae), you could use the ticket to get on the buses of Hiroshima – Tokuyama/Hofu/Yamaguchi/Hagi Line; when you had the ticket for Hiroshima – Tokuyama/Hofu/Yamaguchi/Hagi Line, you could get on the daytime limited express Maiko-go (from Nakasuji Station/Hiroshima Bus Center to Tokuyama Station-mae.)
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました
sen.e: The new service began: when you had the ticket for the daytime limited express Maiko-go (from Nakasuji Station/Hiroshima Bus Center to Tokuyama Station-mae), you could use the ticket to get on the buses of Hiroshima – Tokuyama/Hofu/Yamaguchi/Hagi Line; when you had the ticket for Hiroshima – Tokuyama/Hofu/Yamaguchi/Hagi Line, you could get on the daytime limited express Maiko-go (from Nakasuji Station/Hiroshima Bus Center to Tokuyama Station-mae.)

sen.j: ただし乗車は空席がある場合に限られ、予約はできなかった。
sen.e: However, it was not available when the seats of the buses had been already occupied, and they didn't accept reservations.
However it was not available when the seats of the bus, which you planned to switch to, had been already occupied.
However it was not available when the seats of the bus, which you planned to switch to, had been already occupied.

sen.j: また、広島市内のみの利用は不可）。
sen.e: Besides, it was not available to get on and off within Hiroshima City.
Beside, you could not make reservations for the changing buses beforehand.
Beside, you could not make reservations for the changing buses beforehand.
April 8, 2005:
April 8, 2005:
April 8, 2005:

sen.j: - 昼特急まいこ号が大塚駅 (広島県)に停留所を増設。
sen.e: They placed a new bus stop at Otsuka Station in Hiroshima pref. for the daytime limited express Maiko-go.
They placed a new bus stop at Otsuka Station in Hiroshima Prefecture for the daytime limited express Maiko-go.
They placed a new bus stop at Otsuka Station in Hiroshima Prefecture for the daytime limited express Maiko-go.

sen.j: - 京都交通 (亀岡)の事業廃止により、SANYO EXPRESS・まいこ号の京都交通 （亀岡）担当便が京阪京都交通に移管された。
sen.e: As Kyoto Kotsu in Kameoka City had abolished the services, Keihan Kyoto Kotsu took over the management of the SANYO EXPRESS and the Maiko-go.
sen.cmt: 正しくはAfter Kyoto Kotsu in Kameoka City had gone bankrupt,
sen.e: As Kyoto Kotsu in Kameoka City had abolished the services, Keihan Kyoto Kotsu took over the management of SANYO EXPRESS and Maiko-go.
As Kyoto Kotsu in Kameoka City had abolished the services, Keihan Kyoto Kotsu took over the management of SANYO EXPRESS and Maiko-go.

sen.j: - 広島昼特急京都号に西日本ジェイアールバスが参入。
sen.e: West Japan JR Bus Company began the operation of the Hiroshima daytime limited express Kyoto-go.
West Japan JR Bus Company began the operation of the daytime limited express Hiroshima Kyoto-go.
sen.cmt: the daytime limited express Hiroshima Kyoto-goに訂正しました。
sen.e: West Japan JR Bus Company began the operation of the daytime limited express Hiroshima Kyoto-go.

sen.j: 同時に西日本ジェイアールバス・中国ジェイアールバスの2社が広島ドリーム京都号を運行開始。
sen.e: At the same time, West Japan JR Bus and Chugoku JR Bus began the operation of the Hiroshima Dream Kyoto-go.
At the same time, West Japan JR Bus and Chugoku JR Bus began the operation of Hiroshima Dream Kyoto-go.
At the same time, West Japan JR Bus and Chugoku JR Bus began the operation of Hiroshima Dream Kyoto-go.

sen.j: - SANYO EXPRESS・まいこ号の京都側を洛西バスターミナルまで延長。
sen.e: The routes of the SANYO EXPRESS and the Maiko-go were extended to Rakusei Bus Terminal, the east of Kyoto.
The routes of SANYO EXPRESS and Maiko-go were extended to Rakusei Bus Terminal, the east of Kyoto.
The routes of SANYO EXPRESS and Maiko-go were extended to Rakusei Bus Terminal, the east of Kyoto.

sen.j: SANYO EXPRESS・まいこ号は四条河原町への乗り入れを中止。
sen.e: The SANYO EXPRESS and the Maiko-go quit stopping at Shijo-kawara-machi.
SANYO EXPRESS and Maiko-go quit stopping at Shijo Kawaramachi.
sen.cmt: the 削除しました。Shijo Kawaramachiに訂正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: SANYO EXPRESS and Maiko-go quit stopping at Shijo Kawaramachi.
November 30, 2006:
November 30, 2006:
November 30, 2006:

sen.j: - 昼特急まいこ号廃止。
sen.e: The daytime limited express Maiko-go was abolished.
The daytime limited express Maiko-go was abolished.
The daytime limited express Maiko-go was abolished.

sen.j: これに伴い四条河原町・大塚駅・周陽町中央病院入口への停車を廃止。
sen.e: At the same time, they abolished the three bus stops: Shijo-kawara-machi/Otsuka Station/Shuyo-cho Central Hospital Entrance.
At the same time, they abolished the three bus stops: Shijo Kawaramachi/Otsuka Station/Shuyo-cho Central Hospital Entrance.
sen.cmt: Shijo Kawaramachiに訂正しました。スペース削除しました
sen.e: At the same time, they abolished the three bus stops: Shijo Kawaramachi/Otsuka Station/Shuyo-cho Central Hospital Entrance.

sen.j: 玖珂インターチェンジ・熊毛インターチェンジは翌日以降SANYO EXPRESS・まいこ号が停車。
sen.e: From the next day, the SANYO EXPRESS and the Maiko-go stopped at Kuga Interchange and Kumage Interchange.
From the next day, SANYO EXPRESS and Maiko-go stopped at Kuga Interchange and Kumage Interchange.
From the next day, SANYO EXPRESS and Maiko-go stopped at Kuga Interchange and Kumage Interchange.

sen.j: 車両は広島 - 徳山・防府・山口・萩線に転用される。
sen.e: The cars of the daytime limited express Maiko-go were ceded to Hiroshima – Tokuyama/Hofu/Yamaguchi/Hagi Line.
The cars of the daytime limited express Maiko-go were ceded to Hiroshima – Tokuyama/Hofu/Yamaguchi/Hagi Line.
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました
sen.e: The cars of the daytime limited express Maiko-go were ceded to Hiroshima – Tokuyama/Hofu/Yamaguchi/Hagi Line.
December 1, 2006:
December 1, 2006:
December 1, 2006:

sen.j: - SANYO EXPRESS・まいこ号が大竹インターチェンジ入口・玖珂IC・熊毛ICに停留所を増設。
sen.e: They placed new bus stops at Otake Interchange Entrance, Kuga Interchange, and Kumage Interchange for the SANYO EXPRESS and the Maiko-go.
They placed new bus stops at Otake Interchange Entrance, Kuga Interchange, and Kumage Interchange for SANYO EXPRESS and Maiko-go.
They placed new bus stops at Otake Interchange Entrance, Kuga Interchange, and Kumage Interchange for SANYO EXPRESS and Maiko-go.
January 30, 2008:
January 30, 2008:
January 30, 2008:

sen.j: - 燃料費の高騰などによる採算性の悪化を受け、この日の京都・徳山発をもってSANYO EXPRESS・まいこ号を廃止。
sen.e: The SANYO EXPRESS and the Maiko-go made the last trip from Kyoto/Tokuyama, which were abolished, as they had grown unprofitable due to the soaring the prices of bus fuel.
SANYO EXPRESS and Maiko-go made the last trip from Kyoto/Tokuyama, which were abolished, as they had grown unprofitable due to the soaring the prices of bus fuel.
sen.cmt: the 削除しました。スペース削除しました
sen.e: SANYO EXPRESS and Maiko-go made the last trip from Kyoto/Tokuyama, which were abolished, as they had grown unprofitable due to the soaring the prices of bus fuel.

sen.j: 3列シート、トイレ付き
sen.e: three row independent seats, a restroom
